question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you provide is executable when possible.
Please help me implement this SVG image using code: a close up of a person walking across a crosswalk

checklist.title: Is the basic SVG structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG element has appropriate viewport dimensions, viewBox settings, and namespace declarations. The SVG should have a reasonable size (e.g., 600x400 or similar) with properly set width/height attributes or responsive sizing. Deduct 5 points if the basic structure is incorrect, 3 points if dimensions are inappropriate for the scene. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the implementation accurately depict a close-up of a person walking across a crosswalk?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the core visual elements are present: (1) A recognizable human figure with walking pose, (2) Clear white crosswalk stripes on dark road surface, (3) Close-up perspective as requested. Deduct 5 points if any of these key elements is missing, 3 points if they're present but poorly executed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the human figure properly designed and detailed?
checklist.description: Assess the human figure's anatomical correctness and walking pose authenticity. Check if body proportions are reasonable, with proper limb articulation showing a walking gait. Figure should have appropriate level of detail for a close-up view (facial features, clothing details, etc.). Deduct 4 points for unrealistic proportions, 3 points for static pose instead of walking motion, and 3 points for lack of detail appropriate for a close-up. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the crosswalk properly designed with accurate perspective?
checklist.description: Verify that the crosswalk stripes follow correct perspective principles, showing appropriate foreshortening based on the viewpoint. White stripes should have consistent spacing and width relative to perspective. Deduct 5 points if perspective is completely wrong, 3 points if the stripes have inconsistent spacing/width, and 2 points if the stripes don't visually read as a crosswalk. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code uses best practices like grouping (<g> elements), reusable definitions (e.g., using <defs>, <symbol>, or <use>), and appropriate element types for different shapes. Check if the code handles potential rendering issues across browsers. Code with strong robustness should be maintainable and efficient, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if code is overly complex or brittle, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Animation of walking motion, 2. Interactive elements like hover effects, 3. Responsive design that adjusts to viewport, 4. Creative lighting/shadow effects). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that could be simplified or grouped, 2. Elements unrelated to the crosswalk scene (e.g., unrelated background objects), 3. Excessive detail that impacts performance (e.g., too many path points or unnecessary filters). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core image is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code organization (such as logical grouping of SVG elements), naming conventions, and optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if elements aren't logically grouped or named; deduct 5 points if the file size is unnecessarily large due to poor optimization; deduct 5 points if accessibility attributes are missing (e.g., role, aria-label, title elements). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the image meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows modern visual principles: 1) Effective use of color (appropriate contrast between road, stripes, and figure), 2) Balanced composition (figure properly placed within frame), 3) Appropriate level of detail for the scene. Deduct 3 points for poor color choices, 5 points for awkward composition, and 5 points for inconsistent level of detail across elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are advanced SVG techniques utilized appropriately?
checklist.description: Judge whether the implementation uses appropriate SVG capabilities: 1) Proper use of gradients for depth and lighting, 2) Appropriate use of opacity and blending modes, 3) Efficient path construction techniques. Deduct 3 points for missing gradient opportunities, 3 points for flat/unrealistic rendering without advanced features, and 4 points for inefficient path construction. The full score is 10 points.
